result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J. Lindsay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher J. Lindsay is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher J. Lindsay was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Lindsay

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher J. Lindsay in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he has provided the paperwork for the waiver of extradition.
Court swears the defendant.  
Defendant would like to waive extradition.  Defendant signs the waiver of extradition paperwork under oath.

BY THE COURT:  Court signs the waiver of extradition.

Letter from Defendant to Judge
Letter to Defendant from Clerk w/Judge's response

Defendant Christopher J. Lindsay in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Christopher J. Lindsay in custody.  Andrew J. Christenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that there is resolution to the case and states agreement to Ct. 1. Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Christenson agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Christenson makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 150 days in the Marquette County Jail
Defendant is to remain in custody
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200 Surcharge
Credit = 31 days
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in May
Defendant agrees to $15.00 PPF

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant questions the court.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney.

BY THE COURT: Set for Return
Defendant wants to get an Attorney.

Defendant Christopher J. Lindsay in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Atty Hendee states that the defendant has a warrant in Missouri and will be extradited.  Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond; no conditions requested.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
